metadata.title: CVE-2020-16044 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Use after free in WebRTC in Google Chrome prior to 88.0.4324.96 allowed aremote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted SCTPpacket.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16044` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 84.0.2+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 84.0.2+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 84.0.2+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '84.0.2+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
